items.content:
#â€‹545 â€” June 8, 2022 | Read on the web

WebKit Features in Safari 16 Beta â€” Plenty of updates to Safari (Beta release notes here) on the way, several of which were announced at Apple's WWDC developer event earlier this week. This post looks over the highlights of improvements shipping in WebKit browsers (such as animation improvements, Web Push - more on that below - Subgrid, and container queries). Here's a video presentation from WWDC that goes into moreÂ depth.

Jen Simmons (WebKit)

Learn More About Web Components â€” Web Components are used to define custom, reusable HTML elements. Join Dave Rupert for this extensive video course on both using and creating your own Web Components to build robust webÂ apps.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Meet Web Push â€” â€œWebsites have many reasons to notify their users of time-sensitive or high-priority eventsâ€ â€”Â as such, Web Push Notifications are coming to Safari 16 in macOS Ventura (in 2023, anyway). Hereâ€™s a look at how they are being implemented in WebKit from one of the engineers whoâ€™s working onÂ it.

Brady Eidson (WebKit)

Simplify Your Color Palette with CSS color-mix() â€” CSS color-mix is an experimental function that blends two colors and can be used to simplify color palettes. You can define a color palette and theme without too much effort using CSS color-mix(). Hereâ€™sÂ how.

Daniel Yuschick

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • ğŸ˜® The accessibility shorthand 'a11y' is now a registered trademark. Here's a related Twitter thread where some ponder what this means for the term's usage.

  • HTTP/3 has finally been published as a proposed standard in the shape of RFC9114. The Register has the full story.

  • As WWDC is taking place this week, there are plenty of web tech video sessions being added here by the WebKit team.

  • Apple has also used WWDC as an opportunity to debut its new Human Interface Guidelines (HIG) â€”Â the refreshed guidance/best practices areÂ here.

  • WebContainers (a way to run Node.js natively in the browser) are now officially supported in Firefox.

  • ğŸ“† Bekah Hawrot Weigel is hosting a free session this Thursday (June 9) on browser testing with Cypress.

  • It looks like the popular San Francisco font used on macOS is getting some added enhancements in the shape of condensed, compressed, and expanded widths, plus two Arabic variants.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Donâ€™t Sink Your Website with Third Parties â€” An explainer as to what third-party resource requests really are and which common optimization strategies can help reduce their impact on the userÂ experience.

Ken Harker

With Some Help, Apple Passkeys Could Finally Kill the Password â€” â€œAppleâ€™s passwordless scheme looks intriguing, but its real strength lies in the other companies working to end the password forÂ goodâ€. Here's the related video on the matter from Apple.

Max Eddy

â–¶Â Â The History API is Dead. Long Live the Navigation API â€” A ~15 minute chat about the new Navigation API, which replaced â€œthe old and bustedâ€ HistoryÂ API.

Google Chrome Developers

Whatâ€™s the Best Lossless Image Format? PNG, WebP, AVIF, and JPEG XL Compared â€” A comparison of lossless image formats and how they stackÂ up.

Johannes Siipola

Keep Up with the Latest in Startups, Tech, & Programming in Just 5 Min â€” TLDR is a daily newsletter with links and TLDRs of the most interesting stories in startups ğŸš€, tech ğŸ“±, and codingÂ ğŸ’»

TLDR Newsletter sponsor

How to Synchronize Audio and Video Playback on the Web â€” The Web Audio API makes it possible to properly achieve AV synchronization. Hereâ€™s a quickÂ demo.

FranÃ§ois Beaufort

How to Animate SVG Shapes on Scroll â€” A look at animating SVG paths while smooth scrolling a web page using Lenis and GSAPâ€™s ScrollTriggerÂ plugin.

Mary Lou

The Browser Company Wants You to Build Your Own Internet Home â€” A chat with three of the startupâ€™s product designers about how their upcoming browser â€˜Arcâ€™ is aiming to be â€œthe future of webÂ browsingâ€.

Matt Wille

Why Most Design Systems Implode
Michael Chan

Web Typography: Establishing a Strong Typographic System
Alex Walker

Jobs

Senior Software Engineer at This Dot Labs (Remote, Worldwide) â€” Great benefits working in modern tech stacks and amazing clients such as Google, Meta, Twilio, Cloudinary, Roblox, andÂ more.
This Dot Labs

X-Team

Tool Cool

The Best JavaScript and CSS Animation Libraries for UI Designers â€” Runs through nine free, well-coded animation libraries best-suited to UI design work â€” covering their strengths and weaknesses, and when to choose eachÂ one.

Alex Walker

Issue Tracking Has Never Been Easier with Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Clipdrop Remove Background: Online Tool to Remove the Background From Any Image â€” Works nicely and gives you a nice before/after slider to compare. The service also includes an API you can request accessÂ to.

clipdrop

Symbols to Copy: A One-Stop Location for Copying Special Characters and Symbols â€” Lets you easily find HTML symbols, entities, and characters in ASCII, HEX, CSS, and UnicodeÂ formats.

Wenting Zhang

Color Legend Element: A Web Component Providing a Legend for Data Visualizations â€” Built with Lit/Lit-Element and D3.js. You can see various examples here. Itâ€™s legen.. wait for it.. dary.

Myles C. Maxfield and David Jonathan Ross (WebKit)

The 'Form' Element Created the Modern Web. Was It a Big Mistake? â€” â€œthe <form> element was a pivot point for the entire technology industry. It is what changed the web from a read-only medium for physics papers into a read-write medium forÂ anything.â€
